translated: Abridged Ritual for the Lotus SamÄdhi, with Preface

Based on this repentance method, the contemplation of events is all pointed to in the text of the Supplementary Ritual for the Lotus SamÄdhi. Now, fearing that those who practice individually will have no place to seek, and that the examination will become incomplete, therefore, from the urgent essentials, the phrases are abbreviated and attached to this text.

Later, in order to supplement the use, please face the previous ritual below, and operate this contemplation. Therefore, this only instructs to operate the contemplation, and does not record the appearance of events. The user should know to first operate the incense and flowers.
The contemplation is said:
May this incense and flowers pervade the ten directions,
becoming a subtle and wonderful light platform,
celestial music, celestial jeweled incense,
celestial delicacies, celestial jeweled robes,
inconceivable subtle Dharma dusts,
each dust producing all dusts,
each dust producing all dharmas,
revolving without obstruction, mutually adorning,
reaching all places in front of the Three Jewels,
in front of the Three Jewels of the ten directions and Dharma realms.
All of them have my body performing offerings.
Each and every one pervades the Dharma realm.
Each without confusion, without obstruction,
Extending to the end of the future, performing Buddha's work, universally perfuming the Dharma realm.
All sentient beings, having been perfumed, all give rise to the bodhi mind.
Together entering non-arising, realizing Buddha's wisdom, inviting the Buddha, my three karmas are by nature like empty space.
Shakyamuni is also like this.

Not rising from the true limit, for the sake of sentient beings, together with the assembly, coming to receive offerings, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, only changing Shakyamuni and the place of coming, inviting the Dharma, the nature of dharmas is like empty space, invisible.
The eternally abiding Dharma treasure is inconceivable.
I now invite with the three karmas in accordance with the Dharma.
I only pray that the reflections will appear to receive offerings, paying homage to the Buddha, the nature of the one who pays homage and the object of homage is empty and quiescent.
The path of sympathetic resonance is difficult to conceive.
This ritual arena of mine is like an imperial jewel.ğŸ”½The reflection of Shakyamuni appears within it.
I now appear as a reflection before Shakyamuni.

Bowing one's head to touch the feet in surrender and taking refuge, the rest of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are only changed from Muni. The Dharma is true emptiness, the nature of dharmas is like empty space.
The eternally abiding Dharma Jewel is difficult to fathom.
My body appears before the Dharma Jewel.

There is none that does not all take refuge and bow in surrender. Universally for me and sentient beings... (and so forth) Repenting as before, using the ten wholesome and unwholesome thoughts, I and sentient beings...
